name: cannoning
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
cannon
[ I usually + adv/prep ] mainly UK to knock or hit against someone or something forcefully and suddenly, usually at an angle: I was rushing along the corridor when I cannoned into someone coming out of a side door.
[ I usually + adv/prep ] UK (US carom) to hit someone or something and bounce back at an angle: The ball cannoned off the defender's shins and into the net.
[ I or T ] UK (US carom) in snooker or billiards, to cause the ball to hit two other balls one after the other: He cannoned the cue ball off one red into another. If the player strikes the opponent's ball, cannons onto the red ball and then goes in off it, 4 points are scored.
